in_ports.name: file
in_ports.caption: file
in_ports.hint: [Optional] String path to the file. If specified, it is used instead of "File" parameter (with all replacements performed in that parameter).

in_ports.caption: ROI
in_ports.name: roi
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] If specified, it must be 4 numbers describing a ROI rectangle (region of interest) inside whole pyramid.
If not specified, ROI is supposed contains the whole resolution level from (0, 0) to (level_dim_x−1, level_dim_y−1).
Note: if ROI is specified, but exceed the whole resolution level, it is automatically reduced to bounds of this level.
ROI is used when "Auto-scanning sequence" is not "None" or if "Read whole ROI" flag is set.

in_ports.name: pyramid_configuration
in_ports.caption: pyramid configuration
in_ports.hint: [Optional] Some additional information, describing the pyramid, which relates to the given data and cannot be changed dynamically.

in_ports.name: rendering_configuration
in_ports.caption: rendering configuration
in_ports.hint: [Optional] Some additional information for customizing rendering the pyramid which can vary for the same data file.

out_ports.caption: number of frames
out_ports.name: number_of_frames
out_ports.hint: Total number of frames in all ROIs in the current pyramid.

out_ports.caption: frames per series
out_ports.name: frames_per_series
out_ports.hint:
Number of frames per every series, i.e. in horizontal row or vertical column.
Returned only if "Auto-scanning sequence" parameter is not "None".

out_ports.caption: recommended number of frames in buffer
out_ports.name: recommended_number_of_frames_in_buffer
out_ports.hint:
Recommended number of frames, stored in the buffer for resolving problem of stitching and joining objects.
Calculated by formula in the parameter "Recommended number of stored frames".

out_ports.name: builtin_metadata
out_ports.hint: Metadata, built in the pyramid file (when they exist).

out_ports.name: metadata
out_ports.hint: External metadata: JSON content of accompanying .meta-file (when it exists).

out_ports.caption: ROI rectangles
out_ports.name: metadata_roi_rectangles
out_ports.hint:
ROI rectangles from the accompanying .meta-file (when it exists), scaled to requested "Resolution level".
For every ROI of any form we calculate the minimal containing rectangle, consisting of all (integer) pixels (x,y), that x₁≤x≤x₂, y₁≤y≤y₂,
and return 4 numbers (x₁+x₂)/2, (y₁+y₂)/2, x₂−x₁+1, y₂−y₁+1 (i.e. the center and sizes),
scaled to coordinates of the selected resolution level and intersected with the input ROI
(when it is specified) and with the whole rectangle of the level.
Empty rectangles (0x0, Nx0, 0xN) are not included into the result (they are not processed).
If there is no .meta-file, then the input ROI is returned (when it is specified) or the whole rectangle of the level (when not).

out_ports.caption: ROI contours
out_ports.name: metadata_roi_contours
out_ports.hint:
ROI contours from the accompanying .meta-file (when it exists), scaled to requested "Resolution level".
Every ROI is converted to standard contour format, and array of all contours is returned.
Object label for result contours will be equal to the index of the ROI: 1,2,3,...

out_ports.name: absolute_path
out_ports.caption: absolute path
out_ports.hint: Actual full absolute path to the file

out_ports.name: parent_folder
out_ports.caption: parent folder
out_ports.hint: Absolute path to the parent folder of the file

controls.caption: File
controls.name: file
controls.description:
You can use here relative paths (without starting "/" or "c:\"), for example, "test.tiff" or "images/test.tiff". They will be resolved relative the current folder, containing the executed chain.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. For example, it is correct to write here %TEMP%my_file.dat, %TEMP%/my_file.dat or (in Windows) %TEMP%\my_file.dat.
Also you can use in this string Java system properties: "${name}", for example: "${java.io.tmpdir}", and executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}", "${resources}" (chain path/file name with/without extension, resource folder of the platform, containing this function).

controls.name: fileNameAdditionMode
controls.caption: How to add "file name addition" (for example XXX.DAT)
controls.description: This mode can be used together with input string "file name addition"

items.caption: no correction ("file name addition" is not used)
replace $$$ with the addition, but without its extension: /path/name$$$.ext => /path/nameXXX.ext

controls.caption: Secure mode
controls.name: secure
controls.description: If set, "file name addition" feature and Java system properties in the path are disabled, and the path is checked that it does not contain "suspicious" characters/substring like % (property?), ${... (variable inside a string?). Executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}" and starting %TEMP%/ are enabled.

controls.caption: Format of the pyramid
controls.name: planePyramidFormat
controls.description:
Note that only non-pyramid format (1st case) is always available. Other formats may be added in the package.
"Auto-detect by extension" mode allows to detect only SVS format; all other extension will be interpreted as "Non-pyramid image" case (usual formats supported by Java).

items.caption: Non-pyramid image (all formats supported by Java)

controls.caption: Factory class
controls.name: customPlanePyramidSourceFactoryClass
controls.description: Must contain full name of Java class, implementing PlanePyramidSourceFactory interface and providing support of this file format.

controls.caption: Resolution level
controls.name: resolutionLevel
controls.description: Level #0 has the best resolution, level #1 is less, etc.

controls.caption: Auto-scanning sequence
controls.name: scanningSequence
controls.description: Sequence of scanning of the specified "ROI".

controls.caption: Recommended number of stored frames (JavaScript)
controls.name: recommendedNumberOfStoredFrames
controls.description:
For stitching needs, you usually need to store some number of frames in a buffer. For example, if you scan the pyramid by rows from left to right, and every row contain m frames, you need to have at least m+1 additional frames besides the current one to find objects, that are probably continued from the previous adjacent frames.
This parameter is a JavaScript formula, helping to estimate the necessary number of stored frames in such a buffer. In this script you can use the integer variable "m": it will be equal to the output "frames per series", or to the number of frames per every horizontal row if "Auto-scanning sequence" parameter is "None". Also you will have a boolean variable "snake", which is "true" for "snake" modes (see previous parameter).
For example, when you scan the pyramid by rows from left to right, the formula "m+2" will return possible estimation: it is enough for joining objects, which are not greater than 1 frame.
Also you will have a string variable "p", which is equal to the value of the following advanced parameter "Variable p".
This formula is used ONLY to fill the output "recommended number of frames in buffer". You can ignore it and create your own script for necessary estimations.

controls.caption: Variable p
controls.name: recommendedNumberOfStoredFramesP
controls.description:
Value of variable "p", that can be used in the previous formula. You may pass here some additional information, necessary for your formula, like the number of rows of frames, that you want to store (if it is >1), or any more complex information, for example, in a form of some JSON.
Note that this variable is a number, if it can be correctly parsed as Integer or Double Java type, or a string in other case.

controls.caption: Use metadata
controls.name: useMetadata
controls.description:
If set, the accompanying JSON .meta-file is used to find ROI rectangles, that will be actually analysed and returned in "ROI rectangles" result. Also "metadata" and "ROI contours" ports will be filled.
If cleared, this file is ignored and not loaded. It is supposed that we have only 1 ROI rectangle, that covers all the pyramid, but "ROI contours" will contain an empty array.
Usually should be set.

controls.caption: Require non-intersecting ROI rectangles
controls.name: nonIntersectingRectanglesRequired
controls.description:
If set, and if the accompanying JSON .meta-file exists (regardless on "Use metadata ROI rectangles" flag), this function checks, whether some of ROI rectangles, specified in this file, intersects each other, and throws an exception, if intersecting rectangles were found.
Remind that "ROI rectangle" is a minimal rectangle, containing whole ROI (in a case if it is not rectangular).
It can be useful in the very beginning, because some solutions, based on this function, require that the frames, analysed by this function, do not intersect each other.

controls.caption: Minimal analysed size
controls.name: minimalAnalyzedSize
controls.description:
If this value is M>1, if the accompanying JSON .meta-file exists (regardless on "Use metadata ROI rectangles" flag), this function checks, that the rectangles, specified in this file, after scaling to requested "Resolution level", have width ≥ M and height ≥ M. The input "ROI" and the sizes of the whole pyramid are also checked by the same way, and also the frame sizes ("X-size" and "Y-size" below) must be ≥ M. If some ROIs are less than M, they are excluded from the analysis, if the frame sizes are less than M, the functions throws an exception.
Remind that "ROI rectangle" is a minimal rectangle, containing whole ROI (in a case if it is not rectangular).
It can be useful in the very beginning, because some solutions, based on this function, reduce the analysed frames by some gap; there is no sense to analyse a frame or ROI less than such gap.

controls.caption: Use input ROI
controls.name: useInputROI
controls.description: If set, the input "ROI" port is used (when specified). If cleared, it is ignored and ROI is supposed to be the whole pyramid.

controls.caption: Y-size (frame height)
controls.name: sizeY
controls.description: These sizes of the frame must be positive. They are used for calculating some output ports.
